answers.author: Tom Jenkins
answers.text:
Most counties utilizing a four- or three-digit system do so in an effort to classify units by type, kind and jurisdiction.  In my opinion, I think that NIMS requires us to think of other methods for naming response apparatus.  The most conventional way to do this is by simply "naming" the unit by resource type and assigning a number based on local policy.  I have attached our regional and local policies for reference.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is looking to change the way they’re currently numbering their fire department apparatus and stations.  They participate in a 4-digit regional numbering system, but it has many limitations.  They are interested to learn what others do with less numbers and more room for growth.  
Your information/documentation is appreciated!
